Reviews.Title: “Corporate Travelers BEWARE - Franchised Location”
Reviews.Author: Hawkins C
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the reviews below I now see why I was treated the way I was. I later found out it is a franchised location so you'll never get the same Hilton level of service. It stands to reason if it is smelly, nasty with bedbugs and in "the hood", management would strong arm you into keeping a reservation with them. My story, I flew in this week from CA, instead of the using red eye on Sunday I chose to fly in all day on Monday and arrived a 1:30AM. It had snowed; there was only one lane which hadn't quite iced over (passable). No salt trucks out just sparced traffic, slow white knuckling 30 + miles to the North End. I got lost, yes even with GPS (those of us who have worked in INDY know that it not quite right). I stopped on 82nd St. and Shadeland near the Hilton I'd stayed at the week before, behold a Hampton Inn near across the street. At the front desk called this location to get help with directions. The person at the front desk admitted she was not good with directions. I ask her to change my reservation to the location I was currently calling from and she said she could not because they are not affiliated. By this time it is 2:17AM. She said if I didn't come check in she would leave a note for the gen’l manager but there was no guarantee she would not charge me for the room anyway. I explained to her I was lost, the streets are bad, GPS is off. She seemed unyielding so since this is corp. travel I cannot have anything like this on my expense report. (fees and the likes) I will try again. I left location at 82nd and Shadeland got back on 465 tried again. After another 45mins I called this location again from a very bad neighborhood (gas station) people hangin out...scary for a female at this time of the AM. I told employee (who never give their names, call now you'll see what I mean), I told her I tried, please do leave the note for your GM "Christy", I am afraid and I trust she will understand, if not I will have to deal with it later but, I have got to get back to safety. I went back to the other location on 82nd and finally checked in at 3:23AM so I did give it the old college try. Well, I got charged for the room anyway. I have called “Christy” every other day since and she has yet to return my call. Today, I finally turned it over to the credit card company to handle since she does not know the difference between a no show and a life threatening situation or inclement weather conditions which both impeded my ability to check into their lovely establishment. WHAT A NIGHTMARE! Never again. From now on I will drive the area the week prior, if it is seedy no way… but who can predict bed bugs and nasty customer service? I'm telling you don't trust your corporate website alone. Take a look at reviews first, drive the location, and then decide. I work for a major corp. and travel weekly. I have never experienced anything like this before and I will certainly let corp. business affairs know they should consider removing this location from the contract negotiated/preferred hotel list. Negotiating a lower rate is one thing, placing employees in harms way of getting killed in a drug infested area is quite another.

Reviews.Title: “Might have been good once”
Reviews.Author: brufound
Reviews.Content: The good news is that this Hampton is out of the frenzy of Indianapolis and the staff is very accommodating. The bad news is that the rooms are smaller and much less well appointed than comparably rated Hamptons, the neighborhood is sketchy and the best choice for a meal nearby was Bob Evans. For this, even with our AAA discount, we paid more than other 3*** Hamptons. We expect better from the chain - and this is the first time in our three years of being Gold HH members that we've been disappointed. The lesson - check hotel site and neighborhood offerings more carefully.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: jenn194
Reviews.Content: We found out on Thursday that a car we wanted was in but only thing was it was 808 miles from home. After doing Mapquest we figured out that Indianapolis, IN would be the closest stop for us. When we stopped and checked in I signed the papers and then went to finish my unloading the car. when we laid down on the bed it was like I melted into the bed and fell asleep instantly. I haven't sleep well for months due to medical reasons and now I slept 7 hours straight through. zzzzzz. We both said if we go to stay again it would definately be at the Hampton Inn because of comfort and polite staff at the desk and breakfast was overwelming with the huge selection. We are staying at another tonight now.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hampton Inn experience EVER!”
Reviews.Author: Tom L
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this location for a business trip for three nights. During my stay I experienced service that was not up to par with any other hotel locations I've stayed at in the past. The front desk was rude, the amenities were average at best, housekeeping did a poor job and the response from their regional office was very unprofessional. The biggest frustration of all was when I used their business center computers which were loaded with pornographic content, in which the response I received was "we have no control over the material our guests look at". Shame on the staff and management at this hotel, never again!

Reviews.Title: “fine for our overnight.”
Reviews.Author: joepa722
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 1 night on our way back to PA from a vacation in MO. Upon arrival, I was greated by a very polite and helpful front desk attendant. She gave us 1st floor due to the fact we were traveling w/ children. The room was a bit smaller than what I remember Hampton Inn's to offer, but it was very nice and clean. The flat screen was nice, but it appears the cable service is stadard definition negating the use of a widescreen. Free internet service is expected nowadays and appreciated. The breakfast was service was what I would expect. Nothing like you get at an Embassy Suites or Hilton Garden, but it was a nice light breakfast. The breakfast attendant was very polite and attentative to the food and guests. My only complaint would be the total lack of seating. There are about 5 or 6 tables (only one of which is a larger table for a large family). There were people who came for breakfast with no place to sit. The larger table is not suitable for kids because it is very high. Overall a fine hotel. Nothing spectacular, but worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “WILL NEVER STAY HERE AGAIN. BEWARE HORRIBLE NEIGHBORHOOD”
Reviews.Author: PASTOR82
Reviews.Content: Me and several other members were in town attending a CHristian Education conference. My car was broken into while it was parked on the FRONT of the HOTEL PARKING LOT. MY DRIVERS SIDE WINDOW WAS SMASHED IN AND MY LAPTOP WAS STOLEN SO WAS MY BIBLE, WALLET, AND OTHER PERSONAL ITEMS. I asked to see the surveilience tape and was told by HAMPTON INN STAFF that the cameras didnt cover that part of the FRONT. I called the police only to have no one come out take pictures, fingerprints, etc. I was aked a few questions on the phone and was told "Sorry for the inconvenience". WARNING THIS HOTEL IS LOCATED NEXT TO THE PROBATION/PAROLE OFFICE. DO NOT STAY HERE. YOU WILL REGRET IT. TRUST ME I DID.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable, clean, staff Was courteous and would return if in the area”
Reviews.Author: Nursemate001
Reviews.Content: We picked the hotel because of the location. We were headed back east. We received help with directions to the hotel and to our dinner location. The hotel was quiet. Well maintained.

Reviews.Title: “Not what I'm used to from this chain.”
Reviews.Author: JDFitzCTB
Reviews.Content: 1. Room door was hung off center so there was a gap between the door and frame you could see through. But they attempted so solve the problem with weather stripping. 2. In room Ethernet cable was broken , and looked like it had been for a while. 3. Wireless Internet speeds were 24 KBS down and 3 KBS up. I might as well have used the post office to send mail. 4. Their high def flat screen tv was nice. Their standard def cable service combined with their signal loss resulted in a lot of distortion and plain old fashioned "snow". 5. The bed wasn't the worst, but it wasn't the super comfort mattress they advertised. 6. The breakfast buffet was a waisted trip. Watery sausage gravy with no sausage in it. No orange juice. They were out of waffle batter. The seating area is right by the front door so you get a healthy blast of cold air (in the winter) every time it opens. But when I mentioned these things at checkout I was told "I'm sorry", but they just shrugged when I mentioned their "satisfaction guarantee"!

Reviews.Title: “Fine Choice on the East Side”
Reviews.Author: TravelerChriss
Reviews.Content: I needed a room for one night while driving east. My destination was Richmond, IN, but the hotels in Richmond are considerably more expensive than Indianapolis. I also chose the east side of Indianapolis so I could avoid morning traffic when I left. There are lots of hotel choices around the I-70/I-465 interchange, and normally I would have shopped for the lowest rate, except this time I needed to stay at a Hilton property to maintain some rewards program privileges. Of the Hilton brands in the area, the Hampton East was the least expensive, although after all taxes, the stay was close to $100. All that said, I enjoyed my stay. The hotel looks to be fairly new. Everything looked great. The lobby is inviting. The desk staff was very helpful and friendly. My room was on the second floor. It had a king bed, couch (probably a sleeper, but I didn't check), TV, desk, refrigerator and microwave. The hotel provides free Internet access (wired and wireless), which also worked very well. The bathroom was clean and in fine shape. There was plenty of room to move around. Rooms face a main road (overlooking a Bob Evans restaurant) or a large parking area. The area was quiet at night. There are also several restaurants in the area ranging from fast food to family restaurants. The hotel includes breakfast with the room. There were cereals, oatmeal, yogurt, fruit, mini cheese omelets, potatoes, juice and coffee. The breakfast area was clean and well stocked. There is also an indoor pool, which looked inviting, but I did not swim. Overall, the Hampton East was a pleasant stay. It's not the cheapest in the area, but it is still a good value. I would stay here again. (CS) BTW, there is a GFS Marketplace across the street. This is a restaurant supply company that maintains retail outlets that are open to the public. It's worth looking around if you need kitchen supplies or some interesting food items.

Reviews.Title: “Go somewhere else.”
Reviews.Author: flyline
Reviews.Content: This hotel is run very poorly. Clearly mismanaged or not managed. The hotel pool was a mess, dirty and cold. The hot tub was actually under repair so that is something. The room didnt have 'real' coffee packets, only decaf. I went to the front desk to get a couple of coffee packets and was told they didnt have any. WTH no coffee in the room. Then breakfast was a joke. Not enough tables and chairs for all the guests. In addition to that the food was gone and it was only 7 am.

Reviews.Title: “Remodeled nicely”
Reviews.Author: SKanaar
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on the way home from Myrtle Beach. We made the reservation in the car without anything to go off from other than the AAA book. The hotel was nicely remodeled. It had nice granite in the lobby & eating area. (It was actually the same granite that we just put in our home!) The only negative thing is that the hot tub was not hot at all. I actually had goose bumps! The jet pressure was very poor as well. After a long day in the car, I was really hoping to have a nice soak in the hot tub, but it wasn't very relaxing with the cool water temp, low jet pressure, and scratchy seating surface. All in all, it was a good stopping point for a rest.

Reviews.Title: “Comfy, economical home base for Indianapolis activities”
Reviews.Author: cheapohioans
Reviews.Content: Location is the reason we stayed at this hotel. It's only 6.5 miles to downtown Indy, so it's a quick, easy drive to the zoo, museum, canal walk, etc., even if there's some traffic. This is an updated Hampton, clean and well-maintained. Our kids (2 and 4) got a kick out of all the different little pictures on the room number signs. Elevators are sloooow, though! Room: Bed was OK, a little concave in the middle though. There is room for a Pack N'Play against the wall in the two-bed room. You can set up a second Pack N'Play in the room if you have to, but it will block walking access to the desk. You can't move the desk, it's part of the wall. There is an armchair that can be moved. Room has both a fridge and microwave. They wash the duvets for each guest, supposedly, which makes me feel better about the kids crawling around on the beds. Bathroom: Redone and much better-looking than many, but be aware all the storage is open shelving, leaving your toiletries visible to all. It can be a puzzle to find child-safe spots to stow medicines and so on. Top shelf of the closet is the best place we found. Breakfast: Your basic hotel breakfast, which seems to have been hit by the recession as there aren't many options. No waffles or pancakes (even the toaster sort), just pastries, bagels and toast, plus yogurt, juice, milk, OK-ish coffee, a small variety of cold cereal, bananas and apples. They do have honey, cream cheese and peanut butter to put on your toast or bagels. There are also some hot items, which vary. We didn't try them. Pool: smallish and very chlorine-y, but clean, has a hot tub and was a fun place to swim. Business center: Didn't use it, but peeked in. If you do have to use this, hope no one else needs to. It's so small only one person would fit in there at a time. The hotel is not in a posh area - it's pretty industrial. However, we were surprised and pleased to find that it was surrounded by all the amenities a young family traveling on a budget needs. Directly in front of the hotel is a Bob Evans. Turn left out of the parking lot (on the main road) and under the highway for Starbucks and McDonald's, both about half a mile away. Another mile or so down the road is a Kroger, so you can stock your room fridge and picnic cooler, as well as some chain stores and restaurants like Toys R Us and Red Lobster. About four miles away is Ellenberger Park, a local park with two playgrounds, sports fields, and some walking paths. We grabbed some coffee and snacks, and drove there to let the kids just run around and play. More nearby, free stuff to do with kids: You can ride the monorail (People Mover) downtown if you have a train-loving child; it's very short (1.4 miles of track connecting the downtown medical campuses) is free and open to the public, and runs every 5 minutes during the day.The canal walk is also wonderful, and free kid-oriented concerts run during the summer at the outdoor amphitheater where the canal runs into the river. Our kids loved just watching the waterfall at the very end of the canal. In all, a fun, cheap family getaway. We used HHonors points for part of the stay, and got a nice reasonable rate for the other days. Great value and location; would recommend it to anyone looking for an inexpensive but quality family hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A1 Guest Service”
Reviews.Author: marymreid
Reviews.Content: I recently visited the Hampton Inn (Castleton) and was more than pleased with the accomadations of the hotel and the ammenities the hotel had to offer... When leaving my room in the morning to get my complimentary HOT breakfest I had the USA Today newspaper right at my room door...Then was the HOT breakfest, pasteries, cereal, juice and of course fresh coffee... Also a average size indoor pool which has water toys for the guest use which is great for entertaining kids... The rooms are a good size with nice beds and the linens were a step above the rest... I highly recommend the Hampton Inn, on 82nd and off of the 69 highway

Reviews.Title: “This place has zero customer service!”
Reviews.Author: lcloud
Reviews.Content: I had reserved 3 rooms for our dance troupe (ages 8 and 9) at the Hampton Inn East. Our girls are from Indianapolis and surrounding cities and we needed them to be in one place and also be close to the venue where they were performing. 7 days after making my reservations (and a week before our event) the assistant manager, Dawn, left me a voicemail to call her. When I returned her call, she informed me that they were cancelling my reservations as they were a "business" hotel and that they have a policy that they do not rent to people with an Indianapolis address. I informed her of our event and that we had several girls coming in for this. She only kept emphasizing "the policy" and told me that I shouldn't have a problem finding other accommodations elsewhere! I asked for the District Manager's name and number. I then contacted Jeff Brown at the Hampton's corporate office. I told him of my experience and he also referred to this "policy". (If anyone can find it on their website, please let me know!) He told me that people usually call the hotel to make reservations and if I were like everyone else, I would have done the same and would have then been told of this "policy"! (Uh, then why do you have online reservations?) Jeff also informed me that most of the hotels on the East side have the same policy. (I checked, none of them do AND they were shocked when I told them why I was asking) I asked him what I was suppose to do with 16 people and no accommodations. He said that he could see if another Hilton property could take us 20 MILES AWAY! So, I contacted the Marriot East and they HAPPILY took my reservation, GAVE ME A DISCOUNT AND FREE BREAKFAST FOR MY GROUP! The manager there really felt bad for us and the Marriot isn't even a Hilton property! Needless to say, I will spread the word and will NEVER frequent them again. (ADDITION) I work for a MAJOR company and have used the Hampton Inn on numerous occasions. They have lost a HUGE customer as I have reported them as a BAD CHOICE.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place”
Reviews.Author: peeqn06
Reviews.Content: We would most definitely stay here again!! The staff was friendly, room was clean and the breakfast was great!! Hampton's upgrade to furniture and food is great. The price was good!!

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the price”
Reviews.Author: dave9956
Reviews.Content: This hotel was more like a slightly upgraded Super 8, not worth the $95 per night stay. The cooling unit in the room was very noisey and the TV very average. My check-in was done incorrectly, the room car was programmed incorrectly and I had to return for another try. The "hot" breakfast was dried out Canadian Bacon with round egg patty things. The cold breakfast was fine, but not worth the added cost. I would not stay here again. I'd pay more for a Hilton Garden Inn or less for a Fairfield Inn (Marriott).

HotelInfo.Name: Hampton Inn Indianapolis East
HotelInfo.Address: 2311 N. Shadeland Ave, Indianapolis, IN 46219
